tit.cmt: 記事の内容を知らせるため、英訳を追記しました。

sen.j: 法学校（ほうがっこう）は、明治初期に司法省が管轄した教育機関であり、現在の東京大学法学部の前身の一つである。
sen.e: Ho-gakko (law school) was an educational institution governed by the Ministry of Justice in the early Meiji Period and was one of the previous bodies of the existing Law Department of Tokyo University.

Ho-gakko (law school) was an educational institution governed by the Ministry of Justice in the early Meiji Period and was one of the previous bodies of the existing the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Law.
sen.cmt: Law Department of Tokyo University → The University of Tokyo, Faculty of Law
sen.e: Ho-gakko (law school) was an educational institution governed by the Ministry of Justice in the early Meiji Period and was one of the previous bodies of the existing the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Law.

sen.j: 卒業者には「法律学士」の称号が与えられたが、帝国大学成立以前に「学士」の称号を与えることが出来た高等教育機関は、東京大学の他、司法省法学校、工部省工部大学校、開拓使札幌農学校、農商務省 (日本)駒場農学校である。
sen.e: The graduates of this school was given the title of 'Bachelor of Art in Law' and the higher educational institutions that could give the title of 'Bachelor of Art' before the Imperial universities were founded were the law school of the Ministry of Justice, Engineering University of the Ministry of Engineering, Settlers' Sapporo Agricultural School, and Komaba Agricultural School of the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan), in addition to Tokyo University.

The graduates of this school was given the title of 'Bachelor of Art in Law' and other higher educational institutions that could give the title of 'Bachelor of Art' before the Imperial universities were founded were the law school of the Ministry of Justice, the Imperial College of Engineering of the Ministry of Engineering, Settlers' Sapporo Agricultural School, and Komaba Agricultural School of the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan), in addition to Tokyo University.
sen.cmt: and the→and other用語集に（できるだけ）統一
sen.e: The graduates of this school was given the title of 'Bachelor of Art in Law' and other higher educational institutions that could give the title of 'Bachelor of Art' before the Imperial universities were founded were the law school of the Ministry of Justice, the Imperial College of Engineering of the Ministry of Engineering, Settlers' Sapporo Agricultural School, and Komaba Agricultural School of the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan), in addition to Tokyo University.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）9月に創設された司法省明法寮を起源にもつ。
sen.e: Ho-gakko was originated from Meiho-ryo dormitory which was founded in September 1871.
Ho-gakko was originated from Meiho-ryo (Institute for Legal Studies) of Ministry of Justice which was founded in September 1871.
Ho-gakko was originated from Meiho-ryo (Institute for Legal Studies) of Ministry of Justice which was founded in September 1871.

sen.j: 設立には江藤新平が関与している。
sen.e: Shinpei ETO participated in the foundation of it.
Shinpei ETO participated in the foundation of it.
Shinpei ETO participated in the foundation of it.

sen.j: 当初は定員100名を想定していたが、予算の関係から20名に縮減された。
sen.e: In the initial stage, the school was expected to accommodate 100 students, however, the number of the students was reduced to 20 due to its financial circumstances.
In the initial stage, the school was expected to accommodate 100 students, however, the number of the students was reduced to 20 due to its financial circumstances.
In the initial stage, the school was expected to accommodate 100 students, however, the number of the students was reduced to 20 due to its financial circumstances.

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年）7月に生徒20名を入学させ、フランス法を中心とする法学教育を行った。
sen.e: In July 1872, 20 students were accommodated and were provided with the education on law mainly about French law.
In July 1872, 20 students were accommodated and were provided with the education on law mainly about French law.
In July 1872, 20 students were accommodated and were provided with the education on law mainly about French law.

sen.j: 途中で生徒の一部が中退し、新たに募集が行われたため、在籍者の総計は36名になる。
sen.e: Some of the students left the school in the middle of the course and some students were newly recruited and, therefore, the total number of the students registered was 36.
Some of the students left the school in the middle of the course and some students were newly recruited and, therefore, the total number of the students registered was 36.
Some of the students left the school in the middle of the course and some students were newly recruited and, therefore, the total number of the students registered was 36.

sen.j: 法学教育を担当したのは、フランス人御雇い外国人、ギュスターヴ・エミール・ボアソナードとジョルジュ・ブスケである。
sen.e: The person who was in charge of the education on law was a French man who was one of the foreigners employed by the National Government, Gustav Emile Boisonard and Giorgio Buske.
Gustave Emile BOISSONADE and Georges BOUSQUET, frenchmen employed by the National Government, were in charge of the education on law.
sen.cmt: 簡潔にしました。用語集に統一
sen.e: Gustave Emile BOISSONADE and Georges BOUSQUET, frenchmen employed by the National Government, were in charge of the education on law.

sen.j: フランス語の教育は、事前にアンリ・ド・リブロールが施した。
sen.e: The education on French language was given in advance by Henri de Liblor.
The education on French language was given in advance by Henri de Riberolles.
The education on French language was given in advance by Henri de Riberolles.

sen.j: 1875年（明治8年）5月に司法省所管の法学校となった。
sen.e: This school became a law school under the Ministry of Justice in May 1875.
This school became a law school under the control of Ministry of Justice in May 1875.
This school became a law school under the control of Ministry of Justice in May 1875.

sen.j: 麹町区永楽町の司法省敷地内にあった旧信濃国松本藩（松平丹波守）邸の建物を使用していた。
sen.e: This school used the building of the mansion of the ex-Matsumoto Domain of ex-Shinano Province (the lord was Tanbanokami MATSUDAIRA).
This school used the building of the mansion of the former Matsumoto Domain of Shinano Province (the lord was Tanbanokami MATSUDAIRA).
This school used the building of the mansion of the former Matsumoto Domain of Shinano Province (the lord was Tanbanokami MATSUDAIRA).

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）7月に第一期生20名が卒業した。
sen.e: The 20 students as the first-year-entered students graduated in July 1876.
The 20 students of the inaugural class graduated in July 1876.
sen.cmt: students of the inaugural classに代えました
sen.e: The 20 students of the inaugural class graduated in July 1876.

sen.j: 前年、フランスへ留学した7名中客死した2名を除く5名を加えた25名に対し、後に「法律学士」の称号が与えられた。
sen.e: In the previous year, the title of 'Bachelor of Art in law' was given to each of 25 students that included these 20 students and five students of the seven students who had studied abroad in France and had lost two of them because of their death.

Later on, the title of 'Bachelor of Art in law' was given to each of 25 students that included these 20 students and five of the seven students who went to France as foreign students in the previous year (two of them died abroad).
sen.cmt: in the previous yearを後ろに回しました。
sen.e: Later on, the title of 'Bachelor of Art in law' was given to each of 25 students that included these 20 students and five of the seven students who went to France as foreign students in the previous year (two of them died abroad).

sen.j: 第一期生の卒業を受け、第二期生が入学。
sen.e: In response to the graduation of the first-year-entered students, the second-year-entered students entered.
Following the graduation of the students of the inaugural class, the second generation students entered.
sen.cmt: students of the inaugural classに代えました
sen.e: Following the graduation of the students of the inaugural class, the second generation students entered.

sen.j: 第二期生以降は修業年限が8年（予科4年、本科4年）となった。
sen.e: The second-year-entered students and the students who entered later had to study for eight years (four years for the preparatory course and four years for the main course).
From the second generation students, the term of study was laid down as eight years (four years for the preparatory course and four years for the main course).
sen.cmt: 2年目ではなく4年経っているので、second-year-entered students → second generation studentsとしました。
sen.e: From the second generation students, the term of study was laid down as eight years (four years for the preparatory course and four years for the main course).

sen.j: また、定員が20名から100名に拡張された。
sen.e: The capacity of the school was expanded from 20 to 100 students.
The capacity of the school was expanded from 20 to 100 students.
The capacity of the school was expanded from 20 to 100 students.

sen.j: 予科はフランス語を中心とする普通教育、本科ではフランス語による法学教育が行われた。
sen.e: The preparatory course provided the ordinary education including that of French language as the core and the main course provided law education in French.
The preparatory course provided the ordinary education including that of French language as the core and the main course provided law education in French.
The preparatory course provided the ordinary education including that of French language as the core and the main course provided law education in French.

sen.j: 法学教育を担当したのは、フランス人御雇い外国人ジョルジュ・アッペールである。
sen.e: The person in charge of the law education was a French employee of the National Government, Giorge Abber.
The person in charge of the law education was a French employee of the National Government, Georges APPERT.
The person in charge of the law education was a French employee of the National Government, Georges APPERT.

sen.j: 第二期生は1884年（明治17年）7月卒業したが、入学生104名中、卒業生は37名（法律学士33名、成業4名）である。
sen.e: The second-year-entered students graduated in July 1884 and the graduates were 37 (33 bachelors of law and four students just finished the courses) of the 104 students who had entered.
The second generation students graduated in July 1884, however the number of graduates was 37 (33 bachelors of law and four students just finished the courses) of the 104 students who had entered.
The second generation students graduated in July 1884, however the number of graduates was 37 (33 bachelors of law and four students just finished the courses) of the 104 students who had entered.

sen.j: 第二期生が本科に進んだ1880年（明治13年）9月に第三期生53名が入学。
sen.e: When the second-year-entered students advanced to the main course in September 1880, the third-year-entered students entered.
When the second generation students advanced to the main course in September 1880, the third generation students entered.
When the second generation students advanced to the main course in September 1880, the third generation students entered.

sen.j: 司法省法学校としては、1884年（明治17年）10月に入学した第四期生75名が最後の生徒となる。
sen.e: The 75 students who were the fourth-year-entered students and who entered in October 1884 were the last students.
The 75 students, the fourth and last generation students, entered in October 1884.
The 75 students, the fourth and last generation students, entered in October 1884.

sen.j: 第三期生までは生徒全員が官費生であったが、第四期生から一部私費生となった。
sen.e: Up to the third-year-entered students, all the students were financed by the National Government, however, some of the fourth-year-entered students were privately financed.
Up to the third generation students, all the students were financed by the National Government, however, some of the fourth generation students were privately financed.
Up to the third generation students, all the students were financed by the National Government, however, some of the fourth generation students were privately financed.

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）12月に文部省に移管されて東京法学校となり、1885年（明治18年）9月に東京大学法学部に統合された。
sen.e: In December 1884, the school was transferred to the Ministry of Education and changed its name to Tokyo Ho-Gakko and was consolidated into the law department of Tokyo University in September 1885.
In December 1884, the school was transferred to the Ministry of Education and changed its name to Tokyo Ho-Gakko and was consolidated into the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Law in September 1885.
In December 1884, the school was transferred to the Ministry of Education and changed its name to Tokyo Ho-Gakko and was consolidated into the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Law in September 1885.

sen.j: 統合に伴い、在校生は東京大学法学部に移管され、中途退学者を除き1888年（明治21年）以降、帝国大学法科大学仏法科を卒業しているが、卒業生は第三期生36名、第四期生36名である。
sen.e: With the consolidation, the students studying in the school were transferred to the law department of Tokyo University and, excluding those who left the school halfway, the students graduated the French law course of Law University of the Imperial University in and after 1888 and the graduates counted 36 as the third-year-entered students and 36 as the fourth-year-entered students.

With the consolidation, the students studying in the school were transferred to the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Law and, excluding those who left the school halfway, the students graduated the French law course of Law University of the Imperial University in and after 1888 and the graduates counted 36 as the third generation students and 36 as the fourth generation students.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一third generation studentsfourth generation students
sen.e: With the consolidation, the students studying in the school were transferred to the University of Tokyo, Faculty of Law and, excluding those who left the school halfway, the students graduated the French law course of Law University of the Imperial University in and after 1888 and the graduates counted 36 as the third generation students and 36 as the fourth generation students.

sen.j: 8年制の「正則科」の他に、日本語により2年ないし3年間の法学教育を行った「速成科」もおかれ、第三期生まで教育を行った。
sen.e: In addition to the eight-year 'ordinary studying course', 'quick studying course' was provided which provided two- or three-year law education in Japanese, and educated the students up to the third-year-entered students.

In addition to the eight-year 'ordinary studying course', 'quick studying course' was also established to provide two- or three-year law education in Japanese, and the course continued to exist until the third generation students.

In addition to the eight-year 'ordinary studying course', 'quick studying course' was also established to provide two- or three-year law education in Japanese, and the course continued to exist until the third generation students.

sen.j: 卒業生は西洋近代法を修得した最初の世代であり、その多くは裁判官・検察官として明治期日本の司法を支えた。
sen.e: The graduates of the school were the first generation that had mastered the Western modern laws and, many of them supported the judicature in Japan in Meiji period as judges and prosecutors.
The graduates of the school were the first generation that had mastered the Western modern laws and, many of them supported the judicature in Japan in Meiji period as judges and prosecutors.
The graduates of the school were the first generation that had mastered the Western modern laws and, many of them supported the judicature in Japan in Meiji period as judges and prosecutors.

sen.j: また、第一期生はギュスターヴ・エミール・ボアソナードによる旧民法などの法典編纂に協力し、民法典論争においては断行派の中核となった。
sen.e: The first-year-entered students helped compilation of the codes such as the old civil laws led by Gustav Emile Boisonard and became the core of the assertor group in the controversy on the civil code.

The first generation students helped compilation of the codes such as the old civil laws led by Gustave Emile BOISSONADE and became the core of the assertor group in the controversy on the civil code.

The first generation students helped compilation of the codes such as the old civil laws led by Gustave Emile BOISSONADE and became the core of the assertor group in the controversy on the civil code.

sen.j: このほか、第一期生の過半数は明治大学（明治法律学校）の創立に関与しており、その縁故で第二期生以降の中にも同学の講師となった者がいる。
sen.e: In addition, more than a half of the first-year-entered students were engaged in founding Meiji University (Meiji Horitsu Gakko) and, in this relation, some of the graduates who entered the school in its second or later years served the university as lecturers in it.

In addition, more than a half of the first generation students were engaged in founding Meiji University (Meiji Horitsu Gakko) and, in this relation, some of the graduates who entered the school in its second or later years served the university as lecturers in it.

In addition, more than a half of the first generation students were engaged in founding Meiji University (Meiji Horitsu Gakko) and, in this relation, some of the graduates who entered the school in its second or later years served the university as lecturers in it.

sen.j: また、出身者の何人かは関西大学（関西法律学校）の創立に関与している。
sen.e: Some of the graduates were participated in founding Kansai University (Kansai Horitsu Gakko).
Some of the graduates were participated in founding Kansai University (Kansai Horitsu Gakko).
Some of the graduates were participated in founding Kansai University (Kansai Horitsu Gakko).
